page.title: 04 PIG FARMING
page.content: {WILLOW FARM LEGBOURNE Mr.Clarey runs his 140 acre pig farm alone apart from one extra worker during harvest.700 pigs including 3 boars and 65 sows are reared indoors. The Large White/Landacre crossbred sows on average produce 22 piglets per year.The piglets are fattened up on home produced meal of wheat and barley plus protein additive and soya beans in 22 weeks.When the pig leaves the farm its weight is 80kgs and 60kgs when slaughtered. The pigs are bedded on straw wuth automatic feeding and watering systems which minimise labour.20sows and a boar run outside in a grass field for 6 weeks whilst repairs are made to the farm buildings. Every fortnight 50 pigs are collected and taken to the abattoir in Essex to be slaughtered for pork and bacon.
